snippet: Both sides agreed to a “decentralization of power” in Ukraine in the terms of a truce agreement, but just what form that may take remains one issue of contention.
abstract: Efforts to create some form of decentralized governance in eastern Ukraine face enormous challenge as tensions between Russia and the West approach highest level since end of Cold War; deep mistrust on all sides has sharply increased possibility of long standoff even if further hostilities are avoided.

byline.contributor: Carlotta Gall contributed reporting from Yasinovataya, Ukraine, and Neil MacFarquhar from Kiev, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: Both sides agreed to a “decentralization of power” in Ukraine in the terms of a truce agreement, but just what form that may take remains one issue of contention.

headline.main: Ukraine and Russia Face Gaps in a Truce and a Chasm on the Issues
headline.print_headline: Ukraine and Russia Face Gaps in a Truce and a Chasm on the Issues
